16 // decide whether we want C and/or C++ bindings (default matches host language)
17 //
18 // each set of bindings has its own include-once ifdef armor, allowing the
19 // second set of bindings to be loaded even if the first already has been
20 #if !defined(LEGION_ENABLE_C_BINDINGS) && !defined(LEGION_DISABLE_C_BINDINGS)
21  #ifndef __cplusplus
22  #define LEGION_ENABLE_C_BINDINGS
23  #endif
24 #endif
25 #if !defined(LEGION_ENABLE_CXX_BINDINGS) && !defined(LEGION_DISABLE_CXX_BINDINGS)
26  #ifdef __cplusplus
27  #define LEGION_ENABLE_CXX_BINDINGS
28  #endif
29 #endif
30 
31 #ifdef LEGION_ENABLE_C_BINDINGS
32 #include "legion/legion_c.h"
33 #endif
34 
35 #ifdef LEGION_ENABLE_CXX_BINDINGS
36 #ifndef __LEGION_RUNTIME_H__
37 #define __LEGION_RUNTIME_H__

61 #define LEGION_PRINT_ONCE(runtime, ctx, file, fmt, ...) \
62 { \
63  char message[4096]; \
64  snprintf(message, 4096, fmt, ##__VA_ARGS__); \
65  runtime->print_once(ctx, file, message); \
66 }

88  class IndexSpace {
89  public:
90  static const IndexSpace NO_SPACE;
91  protected:
92  // Only the runtime should be allowed to make these
93  FRIEND_ALL_RUNTIME_CLASSES
94  IndexSpace(IndexSpaceID id, IndexTreeID tid, TypeTag tag);
95  public:
96  IndexSpace(void);
97  public:
98  inline bool operator==(const IndexSpace &rhs) const;
99  inline bool operator!=(const IndexSpace &rhs) const;
100  inline bool operator<(const IndexSpace &rhs) const;
101  inline bool operator>(const IndexSpace &rhs) const;
102  inline IndexSpaceID get_id(void) const { return id; }
103  inline IndexTreeID get_tree_id(void) const { return tid; }
104  inline bool exists(void) const { return (id != 0); }
105  inline TypeTag get_type_tag(void) const { return type_tag; }
106  inline int get_dim(void) const;
107  protected:
108  friend std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& os,
109  const IndexSpace& is);
110  IndexSpaceID id;
111  IndexTreeID tid;
112  TypeTag type_tag;
113  };

614  class UntypedBuffer : public Unserializable<UntypedBuffer> {
615  public:
616  UntypedBuffer(void) : args(NULL), arglen(0) { }
617  UntypedBuffer(const void *arg, size_t argsize)
618  : args(const_cast<void*>(arg)), arglen(argsize) { }
619  UntypedBuffer(const UntypedBuffer &rhs)
620  : args(rhs.args), arglen(rhs.arglen) { }
621  public:
622  inline size_t get_size(void) const { return arglen; }
623  inline void* get_ptr(void) const { return args; }
624  public:
625  inline bool operator==(const UntypedBuffer &arg) const
626  { return (args == arg.args) && (arglen == arg.arglen); }
627  inline bool operator<(const UntypedBuffer &arg) const
628  { return (args < arg.args) && (arglen < arg.arglen); }
629  inline UntypedBuffer& operator=(const UntypedBuffer &rhs)
630  { args = rhs.args; arglen = rhs.arglen; return *this; }
631  private:
632  void *args;
633  size_t arglen;
634  };
635  // This typedef is here for backwards compatibility since we
636  // used to call an UntypedBuffer a TaskArgument
637  typedef UntypedBuffer TaskArgument;

649  class ArgumentMap : public Unserializable<ArgumentMap> {
650  public:
651  ArgumentMap(void);

654  ArgumentMap(ArgumentMap &&rhs);

656  public:

658  ArgumentMap& operator=(const ArgumentMap &rhs);
659  ArgumentMap& operator=(ArgumentMap &&rhs);
660  inline bool operator==(const ArgumentMap &rhs) const
661  { return (impl == rhs.impl); }
662  inline bool operator<(const ArgumentMap &rhs) const
663  { return (impl < rhs.impl); }
664  public:
670  bool has_point(const DomainPoint &point);
677  void set_point(const DomainPoint &point, const UntypedBuffer &arg,
678  bool replace = true);
685  void set_point(const DomainPoint &point, const Future &f,
686  bool replace = true);

718  template<typename PT, unsigned DIM>
719  inline bool remove_point(const PT point[DIM]);
720  private:

722  Internal::ArgumentMapImpl *impl;
723  private:

1040  bool _verified = false);
1041  public:

1045  public:

1047  bool operator<(const RegionRequirement &req) const;

1056  bool instance = true);
1057

1061  { return (flags & LEGION_VERIFIED_FLAG); }

1063  { return (flags & LEGION_NO_ACCESS_FLAG); }

1065  { return (flags & LEGION_RESTRICTED_FLAG); }

1067  { return (flags & LEGION_MUST_PREMAP_FLAG); }

1071  public:

1074 #endif
1075  bool has_field_privilege(FieldID fid) const;
1076  public:

1078  LogicalRegion region;
1079  LogicalPartition partition;
1080  std::set<FieldID> privilege_fields;
1081  std::vector<FieldID> instance_fields;
1082  PrivilegeMode privilege;
1083  CoherenceProperty prop;
1084  LogicalRegion parent;
1085  ReductionOpID redop;
1086  MappingTagID tag;
1087  RegionFlags flags;
1088  public:

1090  ProjectionID projection;
1091  protected:

1408  struct StaticDependence : public Unserializable<StaticDependence> {
1409  public:
1410  StaticDependence(void);
1411  StaticDependence(unsigned previous_offset,
1412  unsigned previous_req_index,
1413  unsigned current_req_index,
1414  DependenceType dtype,
1415  bool validates = false,
1416  bool shard_only = false);
1417  public:
1418  inline void add_field(FieldID fid);
1419  public:
1420  // The relative offset from this operation to
1421  // previous operation in the stream of operations
1422  // (e.g. 1 is the operation launched immediately before)
1423  unsigned previous_offset;
1424  // Region requirement of the previous operation for the dependence
1425  unsigned previous_req_index;
1426  // Region requirement of the current operation for the dependence
1427  unsigned current_req_index;
1428  // The type of the dependence
1429  DependenceType dependence_type;
1430  // Whether this requirement validates the previous writer
1431  bool validates;
1432  // Whether this dependence is a shard-only dependence for
1433  // control replication or it depends on all other copies
1434  bool shard_only;
1435  // Fields that have the dependence
1436  std::set<FieldID> dependent_fields;
1437  };

1446  struct TaskLauncher {
1447  public:
1448  TaskLauncher(void);
1449  TaskLauncher(TaskID tid,
1450  UntypedBuffer arg,
1451  Predicate pred = Predicate::TRUE_PRED,
1452  MapperID id = 0,
1453  MappingTagID tag = 0,
1454  UntypedBuffer map_arg = UntypedBuffer());
1455  public:
1456  inline IndexSpaceRequirement&
1457  add_index_requirement(const IndexSpaceRequirement &req);
1458  inline RegionRequirement&
1459  add_region_requirement(const RegionRequirement &req);
1460  inline void add_field(unsigned idx, FieldID fid, bool inst = true);
1461  public:
1462  inline void add_future(Future f);
1463  inline void add_grant(Grant g);
1464  inline void add_wait_barrier(PhaseBarrier bar);
1465  inline void add_arrival_barrier(PhaseBarrier bar);
1466  inline void add_wait_handshake(LegionHandshake handshake);
1467  inline void add_arrival_handshake(LegionHandshake handshake);
1468  public:
1469  inline void set_predicate_false_future(Future f);
1470  inline void set_predicate_false_result(UntypedBuffer arg);
1471  public:
1472  inline void set_independent_requirements(bool independent);
1473  public:
1474  TaskID task_id;
1475  std::vector<IndexSpaceRequirement> index_requirements;
1476  std::vector<RegionRequirement> region_requirements;
1477  std::vector<Future> futures;
1478  std::vector<Grant> grants;
1479  std::vector<PhaseBarrier> wait_barriers;
1480  std::vector<PhaseBarrier> arrive_barriers;
1481  UntypedBuffer argument;
1482  Predicate predicate;
1483  MapperID map_id;
1484  MappingTagID tag;
1485  UntypedBuffer map_arg;
1486  DomainPoint point;
1487  // Only used in control replication contexts for
1488  // doing sharding. If left unspecified the runtime
1489  // will use an index space of size 1 containing 'point'
1490  IndexSpace sharding_space;
1491  public:
1492  // If the predicate is set to anything other than
1493  // Predicate::TRUE_PRED, then the application must
1494  // specify a value for the future in the case that
1495  // the predicate resolves to false. UntypedBuffer(NULL,0)
1496  // can be used if the task's return type is void.
1497  Future predicate_false_future;
1498  UntypedBuffer predicate_false_result;
1499  public:
1500  // Inform the runtime about any static dependences
1501  // These will be ignored outside of static traces
1502  const std::vector<StaticDependence> *static_dependences;
1503  public:
1504  // Users can tell the runtime this task is eligible
1505  // for inlining by the mapper. This will invoke the
1506  // select_task_options call inline as part of the launch
1507  // logic for this task to allow the mapper to decide
1508  // whether to inline the task or not. Note that if the
1509  // mapper pre-empts during execution then resuming it
1510  // may take a long time if another long running task
1511  // gets scheduled on the processor that launched this task.
1512  bool enable_inlining;
1513  public:
1514  // In some cases users (most likely compilers) will want
1515  // to run a light-weight function (e.g. a continuation)
1516  // as a task that just depends on futures once those futures
1517  // are ready on a local processor where the parent task
1518  // is executing. We call this a local function task and it
1519  // must not have any region requirements. It must als be a
1520  // pure function with no side effects. This task will
1521  // not have the option of being distributed to remote nodes.
1522  bool local_function_task;
1523  public:
1524  // Users can inform the runtime that all region requirements
1525  // are independent of each other in this task. Independent
1526  // means that either field sets are independent or region
1527  // requirements are disjoint based on the region tree.
1528  bool independent_requirements;
1529  public:
1530  // Instruct the runtime that it does not need to produce
1531  // a future or future map result for this index task
1532  bool elide_future_return;
1533  public:
1534  bool silence_warnings;
1535  };

3298  inline T* ptr(const Rect<DIM,COORD_T> &r, size_t strides[DIM]) const;
3299  __CUDA_HD__
3300  inline T& operator[](const Point<DIM,COORD_T> &p) const;
3301  protected:
3302  friend class UntypedDeferredBuffer<COORD_T>;
3303  Realm::RegionInstance instance;
3304  Realm::AffineAccessor<T,DIM,COORD_T> accessor;
3305  std::array<DimensionKind,DIM> ordering;
3306  size_t alignment;
3307 #ifdef LEGION_BOUNDS_CHECKS
3308  DomainT<DIM,COORD_T> bounds;
3309 #endif
3310  };

7528  public:
7529  //------------------------------------------------------------------------
7530  // Control Replication
7531  // In general SPMD-style programming in Legion is wrong. If you find
7532  // yourself writing SPMD-style code for large fractions of your program
7533  // then you're probably doing something wrong. There are a few exceptions:
7534  // 1. index attach/detach operations are collective and may need
7535  // to do per-shard work
7536  // 2. I/O in general often needs to do per-shard work
7537  // 3. interaction with collective frameworks like MPI and NCCL
7538  // 4. others?
7539  // For these reasons we allow users to get access to their shard ID and
7540  // the total number of shards and to make a future map collectively
7541  // Please, please, please be careful with how you use them
7542  //------------------------------------------------------------------------
7550  ShardID local_shard(Context ctx);
7551 
7559  size_t total_shards(Context ctx);
